title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
00:09 <degro> has joined #xwiki  
00:21 <degro> has quit  
02:10 <DrLou> has quit  
05:07 <DrLou> has joined #xwiki  
05:59 <sdumitriu> has quit  
06:14 <DrLou> has quit  
08:19 <npm\_> is now known as <npm>  
08:35 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:47 <vmassol> has quit  
08:59 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
09:12 <florinciu> has joined #xwiki  
09:55 <vmassol> has quit  
11:27 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
11:43 <vmassol> has quit  
11:52 <trivol> has joined #xwiki  
11:52 <trivol> Hello  
12:00 <trivol> I just have a question : I tried to install xwiki on a dedicated server (using the WAR release). I think I succeed to install it correctly but I'm stuck at the last stop : how to link the xwiki tomcat instance with apache ? In fact I would really want to be able to access localhost:8088/xwiki through http://wiki.mydomain.com but I didn't find any help to configure the apache virtualhost and I'm really not used to Java webapp :/ . Any he  
12:00 <trivol> would be very appreciate :) Thanks  
12:49 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
12:51 <+lucaa> for those of the open / free software fans that cannot attend the fosdem (where some of us are right now), it seems some of the talks are streamed: http://fosdem.org/2011/demand-streaming enjoy!  
13:21 <lucaa1> has joined #xwiki  
13:21 <lucaa> has quit  
13:55 <@cjdelisle> trivol: I understand correctly that you are trying to get apache to forward to xwiki?  
14:03 <@cjdelisle> I think this might be what you are looking for: http://tomcat.apache.org/tomcat-4.1-doc/proxy-howto.html  
14:20 <lucaa1> has quit  
14:26 <DrLou> has joined #xwiki  
14:29 <trivol> exactly :) thx a lot  
14:44 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
14:44 <sdumitriu> has quit  
14:47 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
14:56 <lucaa> has quit  
15:35 <trivol> has quit  
15:50 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
18:30 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
18:30 <arkub> has joined #xwiki  
18:54 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
19:10 <SvenDowideit> has quit  
19:13 <SvenDowideit> has joined #xwiki  
19:21 <arkub> has quit  
21:16 <rrodriguez> has joined #xwiki  
21:44 <@cjdelisle> Is there an ETA on return of maven.xwiki.org?  
21:44 <vmassol> tomorrow  
21:45 <@cjdelisle> thanks  
21:45 <vmassol> tomorrow morning  
21:46 <@cjdelisle> What happened to it? It looks pretty bad since it doesn't ping.  
21:46 <vmassol> I think we're transferring it to another machine (but it wasn't announced which is strange - I need to tell the guy doing it)  
21:46 <@cjdelisle> I see.  
21:47 <vmassol> ah no  
21:47 <vmassol> apparently a machine is down  
21:47 <@cjdelisle> Got a patch to remove jcrstore xwiki-core -= 2700 lines :D  
21:47 <vmassol> cool  
21:48 <@cjdelisle> Was cleaner than I expected too.  
21:51 <+sburjan`> 2700 lines for a module we never used ?  
21:52 <vmassol> it was supposed to be used!  
21:52 <@cjdelisle> Not really a module but yes.  
21:52 <vmassol> but artem stopped participating in the xwiki project  
21:52 <vmassol> before we completely finished it  
21:52 <+sburjan`> I imagined it only whould involve removing some classes from CORE  
21:52 <vmassol> wasn't far from finishing  
21:53 <vmassol> nobody continued his work unfortunately  
21:53 <@cjdelisle> porting xwiki to jcr == pushing an elephent up the stairs.  
21:53 <+sburjan`> and will the final package be smaller ? Or some perf improvements ?  
21:53 <vmassol> perf?  
21:53 <+sburjan`> performance  
21:54 <vmassol> I know what perf is  
21:54 <vmassol> :)  
21:54 <+sburjan`> "\_  
21:54 <vmassol> but why would it be more performant  
21:54 <@cjdelisle> I imagine it will cut 50-100kb off the size of the .war file.  
21:54 <+sburjan`> but I guess if that code wasn't never used ... it's irreleent  
21:54 <vmassol> it's not going to change the overall size  
21:54 <+sburjan`> irrelevant  
21:54 <vmassol> (not significantly)  
21:54 <+sburjan`> I thought it would make xwiki faster in some way :P  
21:55 <vmassol> what changes the overall size is the size of the deps we use  
21:55 <+sburjan`> that's good also  
21:55 <@cjdelisle> Actually, the classes were loaded so it will save a few nanoseconds of class loading time.  
21:55 <+sburjan`> also this :)  
21:55 <vmassol> cjdelisle: that said we can maybe remove some hjackrabbit jars?  
21:55 <+sburjan`> make sure we remove all deps from pom files :)  
21:55 <@cjdelisle> The query plugin makes a lot of use of jackrabbit unfortunately.  
21:56 <vmassol> yes but I think there were a few deps only for this but I may be wrong  
21:56 <+sburjan`> I still can't figure how our product has almost 100MB .. it's huge  
21:56 <@cjdelisle> AFAICT it's also using jcr classes for hibernate queries.  
21:57 <+sburjan`> lots of deps jars  
21:57 <vmassol> yes but that's wayyyy better than having to rewrite and support our own code  
21:57 <@cjdelisle> How long should we keep the query plugin around?  
21:57 <+sburjan`> is there any way to see if we have deps we don't use in our xwiki ?  
21:58 <vmassol> cjdelisle: not long IMO  
21:58 <vmassol> I think we had a thread on it on the list  
21:58 <vmassol> can't remember the exact outcome though  
21:58 <@cjdelisle> Great :) That's holding up a lot of cleaning in xwiki-core.  
21:59 <@cjdelisle> It is exposed through some c.x.x.api.\* calls which will have to go through the deprecation parade.  
21:59 <grantk> has joined #xwiki  
21:59 <vmassol> wow we need to remove the warnings from the console, lots of them now  
22:00 <grantk> hello, anyone know why a new install of xwiki 2.7 would only allow xwiki 1.0 syntax from wiki editor?  
22:00 <vmassol> caused by sergiu's com.xpn.xwiki.api.XWiki.getXMLEncoded deprecation  
22:00 <vmassol> grantk: is this an upgrade?  
22:00 <vmassol> if it's a pure new install with provided config files and provided XAR there's no reason  
22:01 <vmassol> if it's an upgrade you need to upgrade the XAR and especially the document information panel  
22:01 <grantk> vmassol: It has been a few weeks since I installed, just got working with ModJK today so was looking again, hold on and let me check  
22:01 <vmassol> you can also check the xwiki.cfg file  
22:02 <vmassol> for the supported syntax listed there  
22:02 <grantk> vmassol, I did not do an upgrade, fresh install, I did have some config changes to make for db, ldap and glassfish so I will check it out there.  
22:03 <+sburjan`> grantk: did you switched to 2.0 or 2.1 syntax on the right pane ?  
22:04 <grantk> sburjan: I was trying to do that because I was getting some funky results with a {{code}} tag and saw that 1.0 was the only option listed  
22:04 <+sburjan`> yes, then you must do what vmassol said  
22:04 <+sburjan`> xwiki.cfg file  
22:05 <grantk>  xwiki.rendering.syntaxes = xwiki/1.0, xwiki/2.0  
22:05 <grantk> looks like 2.0 is enabled to me  
22:05 <+sburjan`> see if you can enable 2.0 from WYSIWYG editor  
22:06 <grantk> sburjan: Not available from wysiwig either  
22:07 <vmassol> grantk: then the only potential isssue is that you're using an old Document Information Panel  
22:07 <vmassol> try import the default XAR again, you can try just to import Panel.DocumentInformation  
22:07 <vmassol> s/import/importing/  
22:07 <grantk> vmassol: ok I will give that a shot.  
22:08 <@cjdelisle> Perhaps the .xar file is not the newest version? Might happen if there are a couple versions kicking around on the desktop.  
22:09 <grantk> cjdelisle: I did not import the new defaults, just used xwiki-enterprise-web-2.7.war and modified the config and fired it up.  
22:09 <grantk> I am downloading this xar now. xwiki-enterprise-wiki-3.0-milestone-1.xar  
22:10 <vmassol> grantk: you should use the XAr corresponding to your version  
22:10 <vmassol> (you're going to have problems otherwise)  
22:11 <grantk> oh, wow, missed the 2.7, thanks vmassol. Will I be ok to remove the old import?  
22:11 <vmassol> remove?  
22:11 <vmassol> you installed it?  
22:11 <vmassol> if so you can install over it  
22:12 <grantk> the xwiki-enterprise-wiki-2.0.3.xar is still there, so maybe I did do the upgrade?  
22:12 <vmassol> there's a difference between loaded and installed  
22:13 <vmassol> to install you need to click on the xar in the import admin section and then do the import  
22:13 <vmassol> anywya just remove them all  
22:13 <vmassol> load the 2.7 one and import it  
22:13 <vmassol> be careful not to overwrite  pages you may have modified  
22:13 <vmassol> check this:  
22:13 <grantk> ohh, cool, sorry last time I tried the import it did not work for me so not too familiar with it.  
22:13 <vmassol> you can check the doc ;)  
22:14 <vmassol> http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Installation#HUpgradingwikidocuments  
22:14 <grantk> vmassol: looks like I may be good, error on search is fixed already.  
22:14 <@cjdelisle> XWikiDocument has 94 methods which are either unused or could be made private.  
22:14 <grantk> 2.0 syntax is available and xwiki looks much better now :)  
22:14 <+sburjan`> 94 is a lot :)  
22:14 <+sburjan`> :D  
22:14 <+sburjan`> chop chop  
22:15 <@cjdelisle> Boaconstrictor refactoring  
22:15 <grantk> Thank you vmassol and sburjan  
22:15 <vmassol> grantk: welcome  
22:15 <+sburjan`> you're welcome .. if you found things that don't work, don't hesitate to come back  
22:16 <grantk> ok  
22:18 <@cjdelisle> Ahh a lot of these are DocumentReference related.  
22:18 <+sburjan`> getting a double sided axe now ?  
22:20 <@cjdelisle> Still lots of stuff that is not related to reference.  
22:21 <@cjdelisle> IE: Method "XWikiDocument.getAttachmentStore(XWikiContext)" has 0 references  
22:21 <grantk> Thanks again, just found annotations and they are pretty cool.  
22:22 <vmassol> grantk: yep http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Features/Annotations  
22:22 <vmassol> http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Annotations+Application  
22:23 <grantk> thanks  
22:41 <+sburjan`> Safari login still doesn't work.. we should fix that for 3.0 ....  
22:50 <@cjdelisle> I have 57 methods in XWD which are claimed to be modifiable and don't appear to have anything to do with recent changes re: DocumentReference, of those, 27 are claimed to be removable.  
22:51 <@cjdelisle> It seems to have a bug though because it claimed that the version field has no references and it clearly does.  
22:54 <@cjdelisle> hmm definitly bad data, I can see other methods which it is reporting but are clearly used.  
22:54 <@cjdelisle> Maybe it ran out of memory while running.  
23:00 <grantk> has left #xwiki  
23:34 <vmassol> has quit  
  
{{/code}}
